roleset.name: save

example.name: all arguments
example.text: If there are any signs that [Mr. Major]-1 will be less inclined *-1 to use interest-rate boosts [*] to rescue the pound from another plunge , that currency is expected [*-3] to fall sharply .

example.name: all arguments with adverbials
example.text: Black& Decker rescued Emhart from the takeover bid of Topper Limited Partnership last March by [*-1] agreeing [*-2] to acquire the maker of door locks and gardening tools for about $ 2.8 billion [*U*] .
example.arg: from the takeover bid of Topper Limited Partnership
[*-1] agreeing [*-2] to acquire the maker of door locks and gardening tools for about $ 2.8 billion [*U*]

example.name: transitive
example.text: The arbs may recoup some of their paper losses if the UAL deal gets patched up again , as they did in 1982 when Occidental Petroleum Co. rescued them with a $ 4 billion [*U*] takeover of Cities Service [].
example.arg: a $ 4 billion [*U*] takeover of Cities Service

example.name: All Args, different syntactic realization
example.text: Several essays also deal with her rescue from the Nazis by the Kindertransport.

example.name: All Args
example.text: Booker, 43, is a rising star in the Democratic Party, known as much for his rescue of a woman from her burning home last year as he is for running a city troubled by high crime and unemployment.

roleset.note: RESCUE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'rescue' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from rescue.01-v predicate notes)

RESCUE-N NOTES: Roleset is based on eventive noun senses in WordNet. Comparison to verb entry rescue.01. Corresponding verb in VerbNet class steal-10.5. No FrameNet entry. Framed by Mary. (from rescue.01-n)
